title: Deploying on OpenShift
summary: This guide provides detailed instructions on generating and deploying OpenShift resources for a native Quarkus application. It includes prerequisites such as having access to an OpenShift cluster and the OpenShift CLI. The documentation also covers the process of bootstrapping a new project with the OpenShift extension, building and deploying the application, and managing custom configurations for deployment. Key features discussed include environment variables, volumes, and advanced deployment strategies like non-S2I builds, customizing routes, exposing services, and securing routes with TLS.
